hello, i'm kels, the webmaster of this site. i am graduating with a B.S. in computer science.

currently i'm a software engineer working on low latency trading technologies. i am also contributing to distributed systems research with a national lab, and am a volunteer engineer for a social justice nonprofit.

this site is just for me to have fun and share things. on here you can find my musings about technology (which are also on substack) and other related content.

my displinary interests include: games, technological accessibility issues, ethics, complex systems, information science, and all things esolangs and compilers. i am trying to learn functional programming but i fear i am not smart enough.

currently playing with: rust, haskell, dynamic programming, making plugins for obsidian, my own esolang

i also enjoy casual stamp collecting, stationary, trains, drawing, zine making, analog photography, rock climbing, and crochet.
